intro: Mahernia cordata, commonly known as the heartleaf mahernia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Mahernia cordata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
